p: In infected patients and NHPs, the viral load in blood positively correlates with IFN-α production [ 115, 116], but the IFN-α burden is nevertheless not sufficient to halt the spread to target organs. This can be in part due to the counteraction of CHIKV proteins. Indeed, the viral nonstructural protein 2 (nsP2) has been shown to inhibit IFN stimulated JAK-STAT signaling [ 117], and the nonstructural protein 1 (nsP1) contrast viral restriction mediated by the IFN stimulated gene product BST-2/Tetherin [ 118]. Whether IFN-type-I overproduction may result in the exacerbation of clinical symptoms, as suggested in a case report [ 119], should be further investigated.
